storyInfo: Dur-nar hits the bar to unwind after a long day of training. By 'chance,' she reunites with a soldier she used to lead and reminisces with him.

attributes.content: Late night
Rhodes Island Landship, 'Just One More Pint' Bar
Dario...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Can I drink yet...?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Today, I—
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, yes. You've told me plenty of times.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: You had to teach some kids who weren't listening, and you fought the reserve operators in a drill to test both their limits and yours, which led you and the other instructors into a heated, 'friendly' conversation.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Would you like me to repeat your ramblings?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Very well, then.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: I just want some booze!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Ten more minutes, ma'am. We serve alcohol after 9. Those are the rules.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Following all those rules will kill you one day!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Following rules is what gives our lives order.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: If you are not happy with that, I am sure you know with whom you can file a complaint.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: We are just staff members here, and we must follow the rules she made.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Grr...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Gimme an apple juice.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Coming right up.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I worked my butt off the whole day, and I can't even get a sip of booze...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: If I were—
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: If you were younger, you would've flipped the table and put your electric blade to his throat.
Huh?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Hank?! What are you doing here?!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I've been here the whole time, Instructor Makayla.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Don't use my real name here. I'm Dur-nar.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Instructor Dur-nar.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Drop the 'Instructor.'
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: That's a no-go, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Ma'am, your drink.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Thanks...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: *Sigh*, everyone's so stubborn, you're all a bunch of burdenbeasts...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Thank you for the compliment, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Thank you for the compliment, ma'am.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: That wasn't a...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Whatever...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Would you like something to drink, sir?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Ice water, please.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Coming right up.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Hah... How come I've trained up a man like this...?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Takes a gulp of apple juice)
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Go on, Hank... What are you up to now?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I'm usually out in the field as a liaison between Blacksteel and Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Our partners at Blacksteel are here for a meeting, and I'm their bodyguard. I'll be taking them back once they're done.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Sounds like something you'd do.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Did anyone get hurt on your way here?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: We had some injuries, but nothing too serious.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: It's all thanks to your teaching, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: The stuff I taught you back then is way outdated by now. Keep using those tricks, and not even the Originium armor they're testing in the military can save you.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: They've already deployed that armor to a few teams.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Not the original either, mass produced ones, usually to elite soldiers like you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well, count me out. I can't wear that stuff.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You can. Even Big Mark wears it fine.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: (Finishes the apple juice)
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Well, you haven't changed one bit. Just a few sentences and you drive the conversation into a dead end.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Sorry, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Here's your ice water.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Speaking of Big Mark, where is he?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: The guy wrote in for me, and got everyone to sign off on the paperwork to let me work here, but he's too busy to come see me?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Big Mark isn't a Rhodes Island employee. He's a project testing manager at Volvort Kochinski. He's a busy man, so it's only natural he hasn't had the time to leave Columbia and come visit.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Volvort Kochinski? Why did he send me to Rhodes Island, then?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I'm not too sure myself. You should probably ask him.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: He's the one you were the most proud of. I'm sure he'll be glad to tell you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Now don't be like that. I'm proud of all of you.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: All of you, Hank.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: All of you...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Ma'am, it's time. May I get you something?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Hm? Booze time?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am. It's 9 o'clock.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Hell yeah. Give me a 'Raging Sands.'
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And give this guy a 'Liberi Tears.'
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Instructor, I—
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Say no more. I get it.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Coming right up.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Instructor...
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Come, tell me, how did you survive?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: If my memory serves, my objections didn't change anything, right...?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: The field commander sent us to the front lines. He treated us like cannon fodder.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Thankfully, his men didn't think that way.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: They saw us as a kind of symbol. They saw in us you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: It was like as long as we were there, Sergeant Major Makayla Springthunder was there fighting the battle with them.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I was just a sergeant. Where'd they get the major part...?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: *Sigh*... And then?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: We finished our original objectives with the help of the surrounding units, and after getting some rest, they sent us a new mission.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: To seize the enemy's HQ.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: The enemy forces weren't in any shape to mount much resistance, so we split into two teams as soon as we reached their HQ.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: One team stayed outside, to mop up any remaining hostiles and provide support. The other went inside.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: We never thought the enemy would blow up their HQ to take everyone with them. The guys who went inside didn't make it out alive.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: This apparently drove a wedge between the top brass after the war was over, and while they were busy fighting each other, we were reassigned from the front.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And a couple months after that, our team was discharged.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Just like you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Yeah, I know.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: All of us blamed ourselves. We were lost.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: We used to think that, as Columbian citizens, it was our duty to answer the president's call to join the military, to protect our homeland, to defend our borders and beliefs. That's what we were meant to do.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: But actually, all we did in the service was put up with a bunch of arrogant officers.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Yelling at our teammates didn't do anything, and taking our anger out on you wasn't going to get us anywhere, but that one month, aside from our training and work, we were stuck in that cycle of negative emotion.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: After we were discharged, most of us went back to Columbia. It was only once I adjusted back to civilian life that those negative emotions started to fade away.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I don't know much about strategy, but if it wasn't for you, that war would not have ended so quickly.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: That victory was Columbia's, but if it wasn't for your decisive assault putting pressure on the commanders, the tug-of-war that came afterwards would've been far worse, and more men would've died on the field.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: How come you're so good at comforting people, but you're terrible at making conversation, Hank?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Please stop making fun of me, Instructor...
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Oh, don't mind me too much. It's just something I said off the top of my head.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Right, weren't you going to take over the family business and rake in the dough? What happened to that? Why are you here at Rhodes Island, serving as an operator?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Report, Instructor—
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: No reporting. Just tell me like normal...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I talked to my sister about it, and we decided that it was the best to have her take over the family business while I would be her second-in-command.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I thought you said you didn't get along with your sister... or at least that's what I think you told me before.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: But after I was discharged, I put some thought into it. Then, for the first time, I had a good discussion with her.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: She's been smart ever since we were kids. She majored in business too. We figured she would be the better choice to expand the family business.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And when my father finally decides to retire and hand the business down to her, I'll leave Rhodes Island and go back home to help out.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Right now... I guess I'm here to earn some experience.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: I wanted to expand my horizons through the lens of Rhodes Island and also make some connections, both inside and outside Columbia.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: This is very important to my life in the future.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Mm-hmm.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I've been wondering, but what does your family do again?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: We're in asset management.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Not sure what that is.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: My family manages the Maylander Child Rights Protection Foundation's wealth.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Maylander... Child Rights Protection Foundation?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's an NGO working to improve life for Columbian children.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: So a charity?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: If it's at all possible, I would like you to—
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well, it really sounds like you were born for this kind of business.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Be sure to really throw yourself into that work.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Don't make a fool of yourself. Got it?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Right, good.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: As long as you're living well, I'm happy.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Gives me something to boast about to my coworkers, haha.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Ma'am, sir, your drinks.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: (Lights up Dur-nar's drink with Originium Arts)
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Enjoy.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Finally.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Downs the whole thing in one shot)
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Phew—Hot hot hot!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Ah, that's the stuff.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You're basically spitting fire, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Easy peasy.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You drink yours too.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Instructor, you know I—
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Drink it, Private Hank.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: That's an order.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor!
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: (Downs the beverage in one go)
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Huff—Phew...
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: How is it?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's not that spicy, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well, of course.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: That's just white grape juice.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: White grape juice?
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well, I can tell you don't go to bars often.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: 'Liberi Tears' is bartender lingo. It means a glass of white grape juice.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You think I forgot how allergic to alcohol you were?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Instructor...
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: You know how exhausting it was to carry you from the base to the army hospital that night? I'd rather not try that again.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Dario!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Something else for you, ma'am?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: An 'Iceflame.'
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You, Hank? Another glass of Tears?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Just a moment.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: What's up?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Where did you go after that court-martial?
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well... I'd rather keep it to myself.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I would like to know, please.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And I'm sure the others would like to know as well.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: (Takes out a voice recorder)
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Hold on, easy. Why the recorder?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: 'We' would like to know, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Oh, you prick. So this is why you came all the way here, why you're drinking with me?!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: This is what all seventeen of us want to know.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And I'm the only one who works at Rhodes Island, so it falls on me to do this.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And you couldn't have found somewhere more private...?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's easier to get you to talk in this environment.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: If we talked somewhere else, like the training grounds, you would definitely slip away with some work excuse.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: And I certainly wouldn't have been able to stop you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Well, you did your homework...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: All thanks to you.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: F-Fine, I'll go into it a little bit.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And I'll say this first: I don't remember everything. If I don't have an answer, pushing it isn't going to help.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Thanks, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Here are your drinks.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Enjoy.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Just in time.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Let's talk and drink.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Takes a sip of the 'Iceflame')
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Hah—That time—I think I went home right after they threw me out of the army.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I drowned my sorrows at the bars back home, day in and day out, then I'd go outside to make trouble.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: My family was understanding, at least. Pampered me all the time. They helped me keep from ending up a total failure.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: After that, my sister pulled some strings, and I got a job working riot police at the local department.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: What? These days, lots of little sisters outdo their big sisters, you know?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: She's much more mature than me. She always took care of everything back home when we were kids, too.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's like I should've been the little sister instead.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Takes a sip of the 'Iceflame')
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's a peaceful little town, so there wasn't much for me to do.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: After that, the city government decided to reorganize the police force and cut down on the riot police, so I got canned.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I guess they figured they could spend the money elsewhere, with how peaceful the place was.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: So I became a shut-in again and mooched off my parents. I felt bad about it, so I took some of the money I saved up and moved to a nearby nomadic city to look for work.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I looked around for a few weeks, and a company wanted me to help manage their security detail. I signed up without thinking too much about it.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It wasn't until after I started that I found out their so-called security detail was just a few random bums they picked off the street to guard the place. They didn't have any training, and no equipment either.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I wanted to do something about it, but whenever I asked for a budget, the higher-ups would start making up excuses and told me not to worry about it if I knew what's good for me.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Now what's that about?!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Seriously, bunch of douchebags!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Takes a gulp of the 'Iceflame')
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I had nothing to say to those stupid suits and their fancy business, those jackwads!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Well, it so happens that there was a convoy heading out to resupply pioneers hiring bodyguards.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: So I took a few of the kids who were willing to come with me and joined them as mercenaries.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Is that why when we first contacted your parents—
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: You see, out in the frontier, it's not all that uncommon for a letter to take a whole month to not even get delivered.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Have you been out there?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: You should see it for yourself, if you ever find the time.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I never thought I'd get to see places like that in Columbia.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: The food was terrible, and so was everything we had to use, but everyone held out hope for a good life.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: But then? Bandits, wild beasts, Catastrophes, you name it. You'll find them out there.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Those days were intense.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Rusthammers, beasts, gangs.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And the goddamned scouts.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: New Manfist's a helluva shithole.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Finishes the 'Iceflame')
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: *Cough*
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: None of the folks I brought with me made it out alive.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It was just me, a disgraced old vet, cast out by the explorers, with nowhere to go except back to the city.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I went back home to find my old man had kicked the bucket. My little sister took over his work, while her big sister was as much a failure as she'd always been.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Heh...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Really, when I got the letter, I was wondering if a schlub like me really deserved an invite to this place.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And clearly I didn't need to worry about that.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Thanks to all of you.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And you too, Corporal Mark Green.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I'm proud of all of you.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Turns off the recorder)
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: That's all I have to say.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Let's leave it there.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: (Puts his recorder away)
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Life here isn't bad. There's a bunch of cute kids to teach, a bunch of loyal, dependable coworkers to talk to, even a commander with a pretty good head.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Plus, I met an old friend here.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Not you. A Vulpo.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: She's an Infected girl. I fought her before with my electric blade. These days, though? We hang out and talk to each other.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: It's nice.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Makes me wonder how long this is going to last...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Dario!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am?
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Any special cocktails you got in you? I'll take one.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: You, Hank?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: 'Liberi Tears,' thanks.
attributes.name: Hank

attributes.content: Heh, okay.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: There you go, Dario. His drinks are on me.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: And bring some snacks.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: I gotta talk to my student some more.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Understood. Just a moment, please.
attributes.name: Dario

attributes.content: Alright, punk, the night is still young.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: We're drinking till we drop!
attributes.name: Dur-nar
